Tutorial.title: Step-by-step tutorial
Tutorial.intro: Follow this guide to move from raw GIF to captioned animation with perfect timing.

prepare.title: 1. Prepare your assets
prepare.content: Choose a high-quality GIF or convert a short video clip. Keep the duration under 30 seconds for optimal playback.

upload.title: 2. Upload & inspect frames
upload.content: Use the uploader on the home page. Once processed, scroll through extracted frames to understand the pacing.

design.title: 3. Design overlays
design.content: Add overlays for each message. Pick templates, edit copy, adjust start/end times, and drag into place.

render.title: 4. Render & distribute
render.content: Click Render GIF. After processing, download the result and embed it in emails, chats, or social posts.

shortcuts.title: Keyboard shortcuts
shortcuts.description: Use space to play/pause the preview and arrow keys to nudge the timeline in 100 ms steps.

styles.title: Template tweaks
styles.description: Duplicate overlays to mix styles across scenes. Templates ensure consistent typography across frames.

export.title: Optimised exports
export.description: Rendered GIFs are compressed automatically so you can share without additional tooling.

FAQ.title: Frequently asked questions
FAQ.intro: Everything you need to know about supported files, privacy, and ways to collaborate.

files.question: What GIF sizes are supported?
files.answer: We recommend files up to 20 MB. Larger files may take longer but still process locally in your browser.

privacy.question: Do you upload my GIFs to a server?
privacy.answer: No. Decoding, editing, and rendering happen entirely in your browser. Nothing leaves your device.

fonts.question: Can I use custom fonts?
fonts.answer: Yes. Paste CSS font URLs in your brand stylesheet and they will appear alongside the built-in templates.

licensing.question: Is the project open source?
licensing.answer: Yes. The editor is inspired by the text-on-gif project and distributed under the MIT license.

support.question: How do I get support?
support.answer: Check the tutorial for troubleshooting tips or open a GitHub issue for feature requests.
